brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to monitor the skin blood flow in the lower leg, with different
      levels and types of applied loads. These loads will not be placed over  the patient's wound
      nor will they be higher than loads the skin normally experiences in daily activities.  The
      results of this research will help investigators understand the development of pressure
      ulcers, commonly known as bedsores and stasis ulcers.

clinical_study.brief_title: Measurement of Blood Perfusion in Response to Loading in Patients With Wounds

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients are eligible if he/she has a wound on one or both legs.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  under the age of 18

          -  individuals with mental illness

          -  individuals who are unable to sit for an hour

          -  individuals whose wound care method prohibits testing

study_pop.textblock: Patients with wounds on their legs, wound clinic patients

primary_outcome.description: Skin perfusion will be measured as different loads are applied to the leg.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cross-sectional, evaluation  time frame is approximately 2 hours occuring at the time of enrollment

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
